bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: I, Wah Ni, being first duly sworen say that I am a resident of Portland Oregon, that I am a chinese merchant and a member of h the firm of Yee Wah & Co. dealers in chinese merchandise at No. 254 Morrison Street, Portland Oregon. That I am now about to depart from the United States on buisness connec- ted with my firm, and this certificae is made for the purpose of assisting me to land on my return; That the annexed photograph is of myself and this certificate will not be used by any other person. 13 Chinese Signature
Subscribed and sworn to before me this ) Eleventh (II) day of January A.D. 1892.)

WE, the undersigned residents of Portland Oregon hereby certif that we are personally acquainted with Wah Ni of the firm of Yee Wah & Co., that we recognize the annexed photograph of the said Wah Ni, that the said firm is now duing buisnessat 204 Morrison Street, Portland Oregon; That we believe the said Wah Ni is about to depart from the United States and this certificate is made for the purpose of assisting him to identify himself to the Custom House officers on his return to the United States.
